io.confluent.ksql.engine

Interface QueryEventListener

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    QueryStateMetricsReportingListener, UtilizationMetricsListener

    public interface QueryEventListener
    Defines the events that clients of QueryRegistry can register to listen on.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default java.util.Optional<QueryEventListener> createSandbox()
      Called when the query registry is creating a validation sandbox.
      default void onClose(QueryMetadata query)
      Called when a query is closed, meaning the query is stopped, and all its resources are destroyed.
      default void onCreate(ServiceContext serviceContext, MetaStore metaStore, QueryMetadata queryMetadata)
      Called when a new query is created.
      default void onDeregister(QueryMetadata query)
      Called when a query is removed from the registry.
      default void onError(QueryMetadata query, QueryError error)
      Called when a query hits a query execution error
      default void onStateChange(QueryMetadata query, org.apache.kafka.streams.KafkaStreams.State before, org.apache.kafka.streams.KafkaStreams.State after)
      Called when the state of the underlying Kafka Streams application of a given query changes

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        default void onCreate(ServiceContext serviceContext,
                      MetaStore metaStore,
                      QueryMetadata queryMetadata)
        Called when a new query is created.
        Parameters:
        serviceContext - service context
        metaStore - meta store
        queryMetadata - handle for the query that was just created

      • onStateChange

        default void onStateChange(QueryMetadata query,
                           org.apache.kafka.streams.KafkaStreams.State before,
                           org.apache.kafka.streams.KafkaStreams.State after)
        Called when the state of the underlying Kafka Streams application of a given query changes
        Parameters:
        query - the query whose state has changed
        before - the Kafka Streams state before the state change
        after - the Kafka Streams state after the state change

      • onError

        default void onError(QueryMetadata query,
                     QueryError error)
        Called when a query hits a query execution error
        Parameters:
        query - the query that hit the error
        error - the error that the query hit

      • onDeregister

        default void onDeregister(QueryMetadata query)
        Called when a query is removed from the registry. This happens either because the query was closed, in which case the query is stopped and its resources are destroyed, or the registry was closed, in which case the query is stopped and its resources _may_ be destroyed, depending on the flag passed to QueryRegistry.close.
        Parameters:
        query - the query that was deregistered

      • onClose

        default void onClose(QueryMetadata query)
        Called when a query is closed, meaning the query is stopped, and all its resources are destroyed.
        Parameters:
        query - the query that was closed

      • createSandbox

        default java.util.Optional<QueryEventListener> createSandbox()
        Called when the query registry is creating a validation sandbox. If the event listener implementation wants to listen for events on the sandbox registry, it should return a QueryEventListener implementation when this method is called. Otherwise, return Optional.empty()
        Returns:
        the sandbox event listener
